name: vSphere Automation REST Resources
description: The folders within this collection represent the Rest API resources and the different operations that can be performed on each. These are individual requests. In many cases, each request will require input that would come from other requests. It is left up to the user to insert the correct data into the URL, query parameters and request bodies for the requests to work correctly. Refer to the ReST API Documentation for further help.

folders.name: Authentication
folders.description: This collection of requests shows how to log in and log out.

folders.name: Hosts
folders.description: The requests in this collection can be called independently. Each request may require various bits of data such as the host name.

folders.name: Resource Pool
folders.description: Individual requests for the Resource Pool resource

folders.name: VM
folders.description: The requests in this collection can be called independently. Each request may require various bits of data such as the vm id or name, etc.

folders.name: VM Add
folders.description: This set of requests will show how to add a VM to an existing datacenter created in the setup process.

requests.name: List details for a single datastore
requests.description: List details for a datastore

requests.name: Update
requests.description: Update Serial to use new file

requests.name: Details
requests.description: List power details for a VM

requests.name: Change Network
requests.description: Change Network the VM is attached to

requests.name: Power On
requests.description: Power On a VM

requests.name: Find folers to create the VM in
requests.description: This request can be called to get a list of folders. To create a VM, we need the datastore and vm folders. If not previously captured during the /datacenter/<datacenter-name> details, the response can be parsed for the vm and datastore folders.

requests.description: Return the Disk related settings of a virtual machine.

requests.name: Create VM
requests.description: This request will create a VM using the environment variables for storage, resource pool and folder.

requests.name: Login
requests.description: Login to the specified vCenter and retrieve a session
requests.tests: tests["Response time is less than 1000ms"] = responseTime < 1000;

requests.name: Logout
requests.description: Logout of the specified vCenter
requests.tests: tests["Response time is less than 1000ms"] = responseTime < 1000;
